title: About the new map for Steel & Steam news - MCCC mod for Medieval II: Total War: Kingdoms - ModDB
text: Today I want to tell you about this map. It is a complete map replacement, while keeping the same coordinates of all settlements, agents, resources, forts and towers, of which there are a lot. Since the 16th century BC, the most common type of world map is the Mercator projection, such as google maps. The second most common projection in the 19th century was Nicolosi's hemispheric projection, which was used by European cartographers from the 1660s onwards. Another projection, the Equal Intermediate projection, was used in maritime navigation. The Eras map is an Equal Intermediate projection of the globe, albeit a distorted one. It is noticeably stretched vertically, with America, Greenland and Iceland shifted to the right, reducing the width of the Atlantic. This is a good way of saving space to increase the total land area. In 1869, Jules Verne's novel 20000 Leagues Under the Sea was published, and in 1873-6, the Challenger expedition took place, which laid the foundation for oceanography. In the XIX century, mankind began to take an active interest in the ocean. In the new map this fact is also reflected and the sea bottom map was added to the sea colouring. The island of New Guinea and part of Australia Also the fog of war was added, hiding the territory not explored by scientists at the time of 1860. The dark clouds conceal Tibet, an iconic place for esoteric sects emerging in the West in the second half of the 19th century. The dark clouds conceal Tibet, an iconic place for esoteric sects emerging in the West in the second half of the 19th century. The remaining clouds show the usual atmospheric occurrences in the ocean. Some more pictures Britain and northern Europe Black Sea, Caspian Sea and Aral Sea Suez Canal China, Japan and Korea North America Carribes Amazon Basin I am grateful to the authors of the S&S mod that they decided to include the new map in the update at once, without delaying its release with long testing. This way, everyone who has downloaded this mod will be the first to test this map. [Steam & Steel v1.1 file - ModDB](https://www.moddb.com/mods/steam-and-steel-total-war/downloads/steam-steel-v11) I recently adapted this map to Eras itself, and now I'm happy to share this version.
